required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: CoaguChek XS in Antiphospholipid Antibody Syndrome (APL) Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Accuracy of CoaguChek XS in Patients With Antiphospholipid Antibody Syndrome

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to see if the CoaguChek XS is accurate in measuring International Normalized Ratio (INR) in patients with Antiphospholipid Antibody Syndrome (APL) receiving warfarin therapy.

detailed_description.textblock: Antiphospholipid Antibody Syndrome (APL) is an autoimmune disease that increases ones risk for blood clots. Therefore, these patients receive anticoagulation therapy with warfarin. Point of care devices such as the CoaguChek XS are often used to monitor International Normalized Ratio (INR) in patients on warfarin. However, the antibodies present in patients with APL may lead to false INR results when using the CoaguChek XS. This study will compare the accuracy of the CoaguChek XS in measuring INR in patients with APL by measuring INR by the CoaguChek XS and a standard lab as a reference point. Patients on warfarin for indications other than APL will be measured by both methods as well to serve as a control group.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Non-Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label

primary_outcome.description: Compare INR obtained by CoaguChek XS to INR obtained from venous lab draw. Difference of +/- 0.5 considered significant

arm_group.description: INR measured by CoaguChek XS in patients with APL at visit 1 and visit 2, in addition to routine measure by standard lab draw
INR measured by standard lab draw at visit 1 and visit 2 for non-APL patients, in addition to routine measurement by CoaguChek XS

intervention.description: CoaguChek XS will be used to measure INR in patients with APL
Patients on warfarin for any indication other than APL will measure INR by venous lab draw

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 18-65 years of age
- anticoagulated with warfarin for at least 1 month
- Diagnosis of antiphospholipid antibody syndrome for intervention arm
Exclusion Criteria:
- any type of mental disability that would hinder their ability to give informed consent
- any terminal illness or any other condition that could interfere with study completion, that person will be excluded.
